ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I thought the course was a great overview of statistical topics in genetics; the class was very straightforward and informative! Good class overall!

I really learned A LOT from this course since a variety of topics in genetics and bioinfo had been discussed with clear details and organized order. Also the weekly assignments are helpful, re-emphasizing the most useful essence of each leture, with both theoritical and computational practice. I can tell that the instructor and TF paid quite a mount of time and effort in this course.

This is an intense course covering a lot of material. The assignments were helpful in engaging with and understanding course content, but they were time consuming. Dr. Zhao was very knowledgeable of the content and did a pretty good job presenting it.
The last two homework assignments could be better - they are too simple.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  I thought the instructor was very clear in his explanations; although the slides are hard to understand without his lecture, in addition to his lecture, all of the concepts made sense. Good instructor for this class overall!
Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  The lectures are very informative in terms of contents! I mostly enjoys the lecture but sometimes the instructor speaks too fast to keep me paying attention to his words...
Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  He is clearly very knowledgeable regarding the course content, but his lectures were sometimes a little difficult to follow as he would explore relevant tangents.
Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Great. Open a new world for me.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I think this course is perfect as a start of preparing someone who intend to study genetics and bioinfo. It's like a comprehensive overview for this field of study.

This was a very intense class requiring a good knowledge of probability theory and R programming. This course is time consuming, but it's a very good overview of how bioinformatics techniques are designed and implemented. I would recommend it to students who are comfortable with proofs and programming, but I would not recommend it to the average MPH student (except bioinformatics students).
